intro: Caladenia brevisura, commonly known as the short-horned spider orchid, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique, spider-like appearance. The plant typically grows in heathlands and dry forests, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to greenish-white, with intricate patterns that aid in pollination by specific insect species. Caladenia brevisura is a rare and endangered species, requiring conservation efforts to protect its habitat.
